commands.description: Outputs a list whose members are the names of all files currently open.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-allopen.html

Outputs a list of three numbers: the minimum, default, and maximum number of inputs for the procedure whose name is the input. It is an error if there is no such procedure. A maximum of -1 means that the number of inputs is unlimited.

Outputs the result of applying a template (or several templates, see the section entitled Template-Based Iteration) repeatedly, with a given value filling the slot the first time, and the result of each application filling the slot for the following application.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-cascade.html
Outputs the result of invoking CASCADE with the same inputs
Erases all lines that the turtle has drawn on the graphics window.  The turtle's state(position, heading, pen mode, etc.) is not changed.
CLEARPALETTE does nothing. It has been kept for compatibility with old programs, but its function is no longer needed.
Closes file
Closes all open files.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-closeall.html
Makes a new procedure called newname that is identical to procedure oldname, which may be a primitive
Outputs a list containing the results of template evaluations. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-crossmap.html
Defines a procedure with name procname and definition text.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-define.html
Pitches the turtle's nose downward by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-downpitch.html
Erases all unburied procedures, variables, and property lists from the workspace
Erases the procedures, variables, and property lists named in contentslist
commands.reason: WebLogo's Code Editor makes editing code more familiar and intuitive than using commands to erase it

commands.description: Erases all unburied variables from the workspace
Erases all unburied procedures from the workspace
Flood fills
commands.reason: WebLogo uses polyStart and polyEnd instead of fill because their meanings are more consistent with both 2D and 3D graphics

commands.description: Outputs a word or list, depending on the type of the data input, containing a subset of the members (for a list) or characters (for a word) of the input. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-filter.html

Outputs the first item of the data input for which the value produced by evaluating conditiontemplate with that item in its slot is TRUE. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-find.html
Returns the flood color.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-floodcolor.html
Command that evaluates the templatelist repeatedly, once for each item in datalist.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-foreach.html
Outputs a representation of the procedure procname in which formatting information is preserved
commands.reason: Open WebLogo's Code Editor and you'll see procedures in a format more familiar and intuitive than from any command

commands.description: Outputs the caption (title) of the window in focus.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-getfocus.html
commands.reason: WebLogo is not for creating graphical user interfaces or managing windows.

commands.description: Rolls the turtle toward his left side by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-leftroll.html
Creates variables that are local to the currently running procedure.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-local.html
commands.reason: WebLogo supports localmake which should be used instead.  local declares variables but doesn't assign a value to them.  The only kind of variable that can be read without causing problems is one with a value.

commands.description: Outputs a word or list, depending on the type of the data input, of the same length as that data input.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-map.html
Outputs a list formed by evaluating templatelist repeatedly and concatenating the results using SENTENCE.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-map.se.html
Like make except with the name and value swapped
commands.reason: Not supported because it is rarely used and seems better removed in WebLogo than added

commands.description: Opens the file named filename for writing.  If the file with the given filename already exists, the write position is initially set to the end of the old file. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-openappend.html
Opens the file named filename for reading. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-openread.html
Opens the file named filename for reading and writing.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-openupdate.html
Opens the specified file for writing
Outputs a list, the turtle's [roll pitch heading] each in degrees.  Learn more at: https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-orientation.html
Outputs a list containing the pen's position, mode, and
Outputs TRUE if the pen is down, FALSE if it's up
Outputs one of the words 'paint', 'erase', or 'reverse' according to the current pen mode
Outputs hardware-specific pen information
Tells the turtle to enter 'perspective' mode
Outputs the angle of the turtle's pitch in degrees.  Read more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-pitch.html
Prints the contents of the named property lists(s) to the current write stream
Prints the title lines of the named procedures, the definitions of the named variables, and the contents of the named property lists to the current write stream.
If true, allows primitives to be erased.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-redefp.html
Outputs the result of applying the template to accumulate the items of the data input, two items at a time. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-reduce.html
Outputs a copy of its input with duplicate members removed
Restores (unminimizes or unmaximizes) the window whose title matches caption to the size and position it had before it was minimized or maximized
Rolls the turtle toward his right side by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-rightroll.html
Outputs the angle of the turtle's roll in degrees.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-roll.html
Scrolls the horizontal scrollbar of the "Screen" window.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-scrollx.html
commands.reason: WebLogo doesn't support scrollX because we want users and the graphical user interface to have full control over scrolling of the graphics screen.  This command would move some of that control to a running Logo program instead of the graphical user interface.

commands.description: Scrolls the vertical scrollbar of the "Screen" window.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-scrolly.html
commands.reason: WebLogo doesn't support scrollY because we want users and the graphical user interface to have full control over scrolling of the graphics screen.  This command would move some of that control to a running Logo program instead of the graphical user interface.

commands.description: Selects a window whose caption (or title) is caption
commands.reason: WebLogo is not for creating graphical user interfaces or managing windows

commands.description: Orients the turtle to a new absolute orientation
Sets the pen's position, mode, and hardware-dependent charactaristics
commands.reason: setTurtleState sets a lot more than setPen and seems more useful.  In the 700+ examples written in WebLogo, I didn't see the need for a setPen or pencommand.  Adding a command for no reason other than to copy other Logo programming tools doesn't seem like a net benefit since it becomes an additional command to document, maintain for people maintaining the WebLogo project.  It also becomes an extra command to teach, and learn.  This effort is worth it if the command is something people will actually use reasonably frequently but pen and setPen seems like it would almost never need to be used.

commands.description: Pitches the turtle to a new absolute pitch.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-setpitch.html
Rolls the turtle to a new absolute roll.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-setroll.html
If assigned a list value in a file that is loaded by load, that value is run as an instruction list after loading
Outputs the text of the procedure named procname in the form expected by define.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-text.html
Outputs the value of the variable whose name is the input word
Pitches the turtle's nose upward by the specified angle, measured in degrees (1/360 of a circle).  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-uppitch.html
Tells the turtle to enter 'window' mode. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-window.html
Tells the turtle to enter 'wrap' mode. Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-wrap.html
Sets the scale of the "Screen" window.  Learn more at https://fmslogo.sourceforge.io/manual/command-zoom.html
commands.reason: WebLogo is not supporting it because it would take away some ability of the end-user to control zoom as the program runs.
